committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Transportation, Aviation and Materials

official_title: To authorize the Federal Aviation Administration to conduct research, development, and demonstrations of alternative technologies and methodologies for enhancing the training of air traffic controllers and electronics maintenance technicians while reducing the costs to the Federal Government.

summary.text: Aviation Training Research Act of 1990 - Requires the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to conduct a program of research and development with respect to technologies and techniques for training air traffic controllers and electronics technicians. Requires the Administrator of the FAA to conduct a five-year demonstration program to determine the feasibility of: (1) conducting aptitude screening and initial training of training schools; and (2) performing initial air traffic controller training at the Aeronautical Center of the Federal Aviation Administration. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To authorize the Federal Aviation Administration to conduct research, development, and demonstrations of alternative technologies and methodologies for enhancing the training of air traffic controllers and electronics maintenance technicians while reducing the costs to the Federal Government.
